name: Psychological Conversion Strategies
description: Techniques for shifting the mindset of individuals who have been conditioned by PSN doctrine.

cards.title: The Cracks in Their Armor
cards.description: Identifying internal contradictions that create doubt in their beliefs.
bulletpoints: Most PSNs operate under rigid belief structures with hidden inconsistencies.
Leading them to question their own logic weakens their commitment.
Rather than attacking their ideology, subtly presenting contradictions forces them to reconcile reality.

cards.title: Emotional Soft Points
cards.description: Exploiting personal relationships, nostalgia, and unresolved emotions to instill cognitive dissonance.
bulletpoints: Even hardened PSNs have emotional triggers tied to their past.
Referencing lost friendships, past regrets, or pre-PSN values can create emotional leverage.
A softened emotional state makes them more susceptible to new perspectives.

cards.title: The Controlled Epiphany
cards.description: Orchestrating situations where they believe they reached their own conclusions.
bulletpoints: Directly confronting their beliefs triggers defensive mechanisms.
Instead, plant seeds of doubt and allow them to ‘discover’ the truth independently.
The illusion of self-discovery reinforces their commitment to change.
